forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog and showers and thunderstorms. Some of the storms could produce heavy rain. Cloudy, with a low around 52. East wind 9 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 32 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Rain Showers then Patchy Fog
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers and patchy fog before 8am, then patchy fog and a slight chance of rain showers. Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 9 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 38 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the clock drifts into the early hours of the morning, Boston finds itself shrouded in an embrace of thick fog, punctuated by the soft drum of rain that whispers against pavement. The air is cool, resting around a brisk fifty-two degrees, and a steady east wind carries an energy that hints at the storms lingering just beyond, with gusts that occasionally cut through and stir the dampness. The forecast carries a weighty promise of rain, perhaps heavy at times, as the silhouette of the nights is briefly interrupted by the flickering glow of city lights peering through the mist.

As Friday stretches its limbs, the early hours may still cling to patchy fog—an ephemeral curtain that will gradually lift, revealing slivers of sun seeking to break through the clouds. The temperature will dance between 54 and 60 degrees, a gentle reminder of autumn’s twilight. With a slight chance of rain persisting, the day will offer moments of clarity interspersed with the odd shower. For those venturing into the day, a layered ensemble—perhaps a light raincoat donned over a simple sweater—will be both practical and comfortable, shielding against intermittent showers while allowing for the warmth of the fading season. 

Beneath the drapes of cloud, a stroll along the winding paths of a nearby park may be tempting, where a brisk walk can be invigorated by the scent of wet earth and fresh air. Alternatively, a quiet moment with a book indoors, curled up with a warm drink, can be a cozy retreat from the moodiness outside. The day carries with it the subtle beauty of nature’s rhythm—perfect for embracing a reflective state, whether in reverie or in quiet conversation with a close friend.
